item.title: Unreal Engine - Level Editor
item.description:
Basic Terms

  • Unreal Editor: Development environment for Unreal engine.
  • Level Editor: An interface used for the design and construction of game levels and environments.
  • Level: Made up of a collection of static meshes, volumes, lights, blueprints, and more all working together to bring the desired experience to a player.
  • Asset: A piece of content for an Unreal project and can be thought of as a UObject serialized to a file.
  • Actor: Object in level such as a camera, static mesh, or player start location.

item.title: Big Data - Data Mining Research
item.description:
Introduction to Data Mining

What is Data Mining(DM)?

  • data mining: Extraction of interesting(non-trivial, implicit, previously unknown and potentially useful) pattern or knowledge from huge amount of data.
    • aka. Knowledge Extraction, Data Analysis, Data Science Information Harvesting, Business Intelligence, Predictive Analysis, etc.

How would you send email using Spring Boot?

item.title: GitHub Actions - CI Pipeline for Spring Boot
item.description:
What is GitHub Actions

GitHub Actions allows developers to automate various tasks. For example, we can build CI pipelines for Spring Boot project. In this post, I am going to go through the steps to build CI pipeline for Spring Boot.

item.title: AWS EC2 - Setting Up AWS EC2
item.description:
What is AWS EC2

In order to have a backend application. You need to have a server. Not everyone has a server computer in their home😅. This is when you use AWS EC2. EC2 stands for Elastic Compute Cloud. You can borrow a server computer with a specific pricing that AWS provide. Basically, you can understand it as a rental server.

item.title: Spring Boot - Validation Sequence
item.description:
Why Validation Sequence is Necessary?

When working with DTOs, you are probably using a bunch of annotations to validate the data. However, what if you want to the validation to go in a specific order. For example if you use @NotBlank and @Size, you probably want to validate the @NotBlank before @Size. In this case you need to validate data in a specific sequence.

item.title: MongoDB - Versioning Schema

MongoDB vs MySQL

For my current project Gabojait, I am trying to use MongoDB. The reason why I chose MongoDB is to dael with various changes that can occur with the data in the db in the future. I thought the MongoDB which uses document rather than table, will be better than MySQL which uses tables.

item.title: SQL - Overview
item.description:
SQL - Overview

  • Many developers say that SQL is their go-to database when starting a new project, even though SQL is more than 40 years old
  • Billions of dollars were invested to create a new form of database(mongoDB, Cloud Firestore, etc.), but people still love SQL
  • MySQL is an open source database:
    • content management system like wordpress
    • ecommerce platforms like shopify
    • social media giants like twitter
  • CRUD
    • Create
    • Read
    • Update
    • Delete
  • Model and join relational data

item.title: Speech - Improving Detection Rate
item.description:
Improving Detection Rate

Keys that affect detection rate

  • Feature engineering
    • Mel spectrogram
    • MFCC
    • …
  • Model structure
    • CNN
    • RNN
    • …
  • Affects of auditorial settings
    • indoor/outdoor
    • reverberation, reverberation, distance, size of room
    • masking, noise
    • …
  • Affects of audio equipment
    • microphone feature
    • recorder feature
    • A/D transform parameter
    • noise
    • …
